group_1.textCenter: In today's extended homeroom, we'll be@having a lesson on self-analysis.
In the future, some of you will be applying@to different schools.
Others may be pursuing employment.
In either case, you will be asked in interviews@to evaluate your own abilities.
(Self-analysis... Why would that be necessary?)
(We know ourselves best. Shouldn't that@be obvious on a fundamental level?)
Now, I'd like for all of you to split into@groups of four.
Each of you will analyze yourselves as well as@your other group members.
What are your impressions of each other?
What do you think of yourself?
I'll ask you to write down your answers and share@them with everyone else in your group.

group_1.textRight: Hey Nayuta, let's team up!

group_1.textCenter: We'll partner up with you guys, too!

group_1.textLeft: Alright, for each of us, there's a self-analysis@sheet, plus another three for analyzing each other.

group_1.textRight: We're gonna show these to each other@later, right?
Wow, this will be really embarrassing...

group_1.textLeft: But...if it's for class...then we have@no other choice!

group_1.textCenter: (I've finished!)

group_1.narration: This girl is earnest, kind, and funny.
This girl is cheerful and energetic, and@likely the most popular among boys.
This girl may appear unkempt, but in truth,@she's very sweet and pure of heart.
I myself...am a quiet, calm person.
I also enjoy studying, and I'm good at it.
While I may be quiet,@I am actually quite strong,
in the sense that when something@must be done, I'll do it right.
Is that what I'm going to tell everyone now...?@It's...rather embarrassing...

group_1.textCenter: Alright, time's up. Please start sharing your@notes with each other.

group_1.textRight: Who should we start with?
I think Nayuta would be a good choice.

group_1.textLeft: (I have to keep myself together...@I mustn't be bashful...)

group_1.textRight: Alright, it might be forward of me,@but my impression of Nayuta is...
She hates to lose!
Oh, that's kind of like what I wrote!
My impression of Nayuta is...
She says whatever's on her mind!
That's like what I put, too! My impression@of Nayuta is...
She's as stubborn as an ox!

group_1.textLeft: All of you... You can't...possibly be taking@this seriously...

group_1.textRight: What do you mean? I'm very serious.

group_1.textLeft: ...Truly? I cannot see where you're@coming from, though...

group_1.textRight: What can't you see?
I mean, just the other day, when we were deciding@the song for the school festival's dance performance,
and the funny song the guys proposed@was about to win out,
you turned against the crowd and@fought their decision.

group_1.textLeft: I only did so because I didn't want@that song...
I apologize for my failure to read@the atmosphere.

group_1.textRight: Maybe that's true, but either way, it shows@you have some serious tenacity.
You're nothing if not stubborn.

group_1.textLeft: (...When framed like that, they may@be correct.)
(Considering how I still persist in searching@for my father...)
(If "stubborn" is the word they'd use, I've no@choice but to admit that's what I am.)

group_1.textRight: Oh yeah, what'd you put down for@yourself, Nayuta?
Wow, look at that! You said you're good@at studying!
You really do say it like it is.

group_1.textCenter: What did you all think?@Were you surprised by the results?
By the way...
Are any of you aware of the term@"Johari Window"?
It's a psychological model that says there are@four types of aspects to every person:

group_1.narration: "1. Aspects that are known to you and others@2: Aspects that are known to others but not to you@3: Aspects that are known to you but not to others@4: Aspects that are unknown to you and others"

group_1.textCenter: That's the basic gist of them.
Some of you may have noticed that only half of@these aspects,
Aspects 1 and 3, can be understood through self-analysis.
What's more, Aspect 3 isn't inherently disclosed@to others.
When it comes to an interview, the only aspects@you'll be able to share are those in the first category.
That's just a quarter of the four that I mentioned.
Aspects unknown to you...@Aspects known only to you...
